We present a number of complete hassle-free event packages to accommodate your guests, or we will customize one to fit your needs. Services that Deliver Success The standard outing package at Fernandina Beach Golf Club is built to ensure your guests experience a top-notch golf outing with our professional staff. Fernandina Beach Golf Club Raises The Bar For Junior Golf - Hurricane Junior Golf Tour (HJGT) Fernandina Beach Golf Club Raises The Bar For Junior Golf - Hurricane Junior Golf Tour (HJGT) Skip to content Menu Home Tournaments Tournaments 2025 Schedule Futures Tour Open College Prep Majors Invitationals Tournament Locations Junior Golf Membership Results & Rankings Results & Rankings Results POY Point Rankings Hurricane Cup Point Rankings Player Divisions Player Divisions Boys 10-11 Boys 12-13 Boys 14-15 Boys 16-18 Girls U13 Girls 14-18 Resources Resources How HJGT Works (Point Rankings) Tour Policies FAQs HJGT REWARDS HJGT PLAYER REFERRAL Our Blog Run Your Own Tour Tournament Assistance College Recruiting Junior Golf Hub HJGT College Signings About About Our Team HJGT Merch Photo Gallery Academy Partners Testimonials Corporate Partners Contact Us Latest News View Schedule Login Schedule Join HJGT Login Join HJGT Schedule Login Tournaments 2025 Schedule Futures Tour Opens College Prep Majors Invitationals Tournament Locations Membership Results & Rankings Results POY Points Rankings Hurricane Cup Rankings Junior Golf National Rankings Player Divisions Boys 10-11 Boys 12-13 Boys 14-15 Boys 16-18 Girls U13 Girls 14-18 Resources How it Works Tour Policies FAQs HJGT Rewards Player Referral Our Blog Run Your Own Tour Tournament Assistance College Recruiting Junior Golf Hub HJGT College Signings About Our Team HJGT Merch Latest News Photo Gallery Testimonials Academy Partners Corporate Partners Contact Us February 14, 2024 Preview Fernandina Beach Golf Club Raises The Bar For Junior Golf Fernandina Beach Golf Club The Fernandina Beach Golf Club was designed by Tommy Bird Songs and opened more than 100 years ago in 1920. It has long been a staple for golfers in the Southeast region of the country, as it is conveniently located within driving distance of Jacksonville and Georgia. Since its creation, the course has evolved into an incredible venue for junior golf competitions. In fact, Fernandina Beach Golf Club will play host to the Hurricane Junior Golf Tour at the end of March for the Northeast Florida Junior Open. How Fernandina Beach Golf Club Is Shaping Junior Golf Former Fernandina Beach Municipal Golf Course General Manager David DeMay has long been a part of the evolution of golf in the area. More than ten years ago, in 2013, DeMay joined the Golf Club of Amelia Island and later became its executive director. Then, in December 2022, DeMay was named GM of the city golf course and began transforming its image. ‚ÄúThe city golf course has a lot of great momentum going forward. It has a bright future,‚Äù DeMay said . ‚ÄúWe have a great staff in place. We purchased new golf carts, renovated the clubhouse banquet room and improved the conditions of the course.‚Äù It‚Äôs clear that the city is willing to invest in golf, as they‚Äôve shown with the multitude of improvements over the years. With that being said, the course itself is not the only thing bringing people to the area. Just a hop, skip and a jump down the road is Amelia Island ‚Äì a beautiful picturesque stretch of the Florida Atlantic coast that makes you feel like you‚Äôre on a postcard. Amelia Island Offers So Much More Than Golf With over 13 miles of awe-inspiring beaches and more than 90 independent restaurants, Amelia Island offers the perfect family getaway and a seamless compliment to your golf plans. The Main Beach ‚Äì affectionately known as ‚ÄúThe Family Zone‚Äù ‚Äì features a pristine shoreline for beautiful views of the ocean on one side and tons of action-packed fun on the other. You can continue your golf excursions by partaking in some local putt-putt or delve into some extreme sports by taking surf lessons or enjoying the nearby skate park. Down that beach is an area known as Seaside Park ‚Äì or ‚ÄúThe Fun Zone‚Äù ‚Äì and is the go-to spot for local festivals. Beyond the beach, you‚Äôll find plenty of family-friendly restaurants, ice cream shops and other amenities and attractions to keep the party going. Fernandina Beach and Amelia Island are on a mission to enhance and celebrate junior golfers throughout the country. As a host and sponsor of our upcoming Northeast Florida Junior Open, we thank them for their commitment to the sport and our youth. We look forward to continuing our work together in providing the best experience for our young golfers on and off the course. Visit the event page to register for the Northeast Florida Junior Open today! Early-bird registration ends on February 19, 2024. Whether you are brand new to competitive junior golf or a seasoned veteran hoping to impress college coaches, HJGT‚Äôs exclusive membership will enhance your tour experience. The Association was formed for any man who wished to enjoy the challenges, rewards and camaraderie of golfing to enjoy. The Association has grown exponentially since then with over 100 active members today. Management is conducted by an annually Show More The FBMGA was chartered in 1966 after completion of the 27 hole Fernandina Beach Golf Course. The Association was formed for any man who wished to enjoy the challenges, rewards and camaraderie of golfing to enjoy. The Association has grown exponentially since then with over 100 active members today. Management is conducted by an annually elected Board of Directors comprised of President, Vice President, Treasurer, Secretary, two Members-at Large, and a Tournament Director.Members enjoy multiple tournaments throughout the year, quarterly membership meetings with dinner and course updates from the Club‚Äôs management. As the Fernandina Beach Golf Club is a City owned entity, the Association is also actively involved in its oversight. A Unique Dining Experience Where setting, service, and cuisine add up to spectacular Fernandina Beach's Premier Public Golf, Dining, & Social Club The Golf Club at North Hampton offers a traditional Scottish links-style course in Fernandina Beach, Florida. Designed by Arnold Palmer, the layout meanders through dramatic elevation changes of over 40 feet and ten spring-fed lakes lined with coquina boulders. Sprawled across rolling hills and wild grasses, the golf course is sculpted from beautiful Florida woodlands, offering a round that is as scenic as it is challenging. Amelia National Golf & Country Club - Fernandina Beach, FL Skip to content General: 904.274.6731 | Sales: 855.214.9967 | Member Login Menu Amelia National News & Events Latest News Event Calendars Location Directory Private Events Resident Referral Program Home Owners Association Careers at Amelia National Amenities Tom Fazio Golf Course Dining & Social Fitness Center Tennis Swimming Pool Fernandina Beach Homes Our Homes Amelia National Sitemap Schedule VIP Tour Discovery Tours Membership Contact General Inquiry Download a Brochure Amelia National Golf & Country Club Gated, Golf Course Community in Fernandina Beach, Florida Residents of the amenity-filled Fernandina Beach new home community of Amelia National Golf and Country Club experience a vacation-type lifestyle each and every day. This truly magnificent Tom Fazio golf course community embodies country club living at its best; from the Tom Fazio-designed, 18-hole golf course and championship-quality tennis courts to the luxurious fitness center and clubhouse facilities . Enjoy lounging by the pool and superb dining at the club located within Amelia National‚Äôs guard-gated access. Amelia National Golf and Country Club is situated in Fernandina Beach, which is often termed the gateway to the enchantingly quaint Amelia Island. The entire experience of Amelia National is geared to those well acquainted with the world‚Äôs finest private country club destinations in Florida. A charming, French provincial clubhouse will welcome you with a relaxing atmosphere of quality and elegance. Steeped in the traditions of the world‚Äôs most renowned golf clubs, fine dining as well as the casual camaraderie of a 19th hole bar and grill will be accompanied by superlative service and fabulous views of the course and grounds. With private meeting rooms and convivial gathering areas the clubhouse has been planned to cater to your every need. Outdoors a sparkling pool complex set among lushly landscaped gardens will be a delightful place to gather with friends and neighbors. Fernandina Beach Custom Home Builder ‚Äì ICI Homes Amelia National Golf and Country Club features stunning, award winning floor plans from Fernandina Beach, Florida custom home builder, ICI Homes . Offering modest single-family homes to palatial estate homes with lake and golf course views, ICI Homes has been at the forefront of the home building industry and is consistently ranked among the top 100 home builders in the country. This is one of the best new home golf communities in Florida and one visit here will have you in love with the Florida golf community life style! See More See Less View on Facebook ¬∑ Share Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Linked In Share by Email View Comments likes 0 Shares: 0 Comments: 0 0 Comments Comment on Facebook Latest News from Amelia National Golf and Country Club Amelia Island Among Travel + Leisure‚Äôs Top 15 Islands in the U.S. for 2025 August 18, 2025 No need to go to far-flung locales to enjoy island living! Plenty of picturesque islands dot the continental United States coastline and there‚Äôs an island style for all thanks to the country‚Äôs numerous geographic regions and climates.
Readers of Travel + Leisure magazine concurred, recently choosing their favorites as part of the magazine‚Äôs 2025 ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Best Awards‚Äù survey.
Florida claimed five of the 15 top choices, among them Amelia Island, which ranked No. 2 overall, the highest-ranked Florida island.
The Amelia Island area also is home to Amelia National Golf & Country Club, the top master-planned community in northeast Florida and one of ICI Homes‚Äô signature properties. Amelia National offers luxurious, resort-style living with outstanding resident amenities, plus it‚Äôs only 10 minutes west of Amelia Island and the historic town of Fernandina Beach.
If you‚Äôre considering a new custom Florida home here, consider that choice already validated by thousands of Travel + Leisure readers.
Here‚Äôs more on the survey and why Amelia National is the perfect home for your island lifestyle.
Key Takeaways

Amelia Island ranked #2 in Travel + Leisure‚Äôs 2025 ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Best Awards‚Äù, the highest-ranked Florida island on the list, praised for its natural beauty, outdoor recreation, and charming Fernandina Beach.
Amelia National Golf & Country Club, just 10 minutes from Amelia Island, offers a resort-style lifestyle in a gated community with luxury custom homes and top-tier amenities.
Travel + Leisure‚Äôs rankings are based on reader feedback, including categories like natural attractions, dining, friendliness, and overall value, with nearly 180,000 participants in the 2025 survey.
Residents of Amelia National enjoy access to a Tom Fazio-designed golf course, tennis center, resort-style pool, clubhouse, and the ability to custom-build or move in quickly.
Amelia National and ICI Homes offer the ideal island lifestyle for those seeking custom Florida living near a nationally recognized destination.

Methodology
Travel + Leisure bases its annual ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Best Awards‚Äù on worldwide travel topics, including airlines, cities, cruise ships, hotels, islands, resorts, spas and more categories. Readers respond with experiences and feedback, which informs the magazine‚Äôs rankings.
Approximately 180,000 readers weighed in for the 2025 survey. Per Travel + Leisure‚Äôs website, they rated islands on activities/sights, natural attractions/beaches, people/friendliness, restaurants/food, and value, using a scale of excellent, above average, below average, and poor. Magazine staffers used those ratings to calculate an average final score for each island.
Mount Desert Island in Maine was the top-rated 2025 island in the continental U.S.
Amelia Island was second, followed by No. 3 Mackinac Island, Michigan, No. 4 Golden Isles, Georgia, No. 5 San Juan Islands, Washington, No. 6 Marco Island, Florida, No. 7 Kiawah Island, South Carolina, No. 8 Florida Keys, Florida, No. 9 Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, No. 10 Nantucket, Massachusetts, No. 11 Sanibel Island, Florida, No. 12 Outer Banks, North Carolina, No. 13 South Padre Island, Texas, No. 14 Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, Massachusetts and No. 15 Captiva Island, Florida.
Why Amelia Island ranked No. 2
Thirteen miles of Atlantic beaches are one reason, followed by natural beauty among marshes, rivers, state and natural parks, and endless outdoor recreation options.
Fernandina Beach is Amelia National‚Äôs hometown, hosting an energetic restaurant, shopping, nightlife and boating scene, plus special events year-round. Museums and historical sites document the island‚Äôs centuries-long history.
Come home to Amelia National
This gated community features luxury custom homes of all sizes and the area‚Äôs only Tom Fazio-designed golf course.
Its French Provincial clubhouse anchors dining and social activities along with a fully stocked fitness center, resort-style swimming pool and eight-court tennis center.
Best of all, you can build from scratch, or buy a move-in-ready inventory home if you‚Äôd like to fast-track your permanent vacation.
Ready for your Amelia National lifestyle? Talk to ICI Homes here. [...] Read more... Amelia National Residents‚Äô Guide to Indoor Fun June 23, 2025 Living at Amelia National Golf & Country Club, a signature ICI Homes master-planned community, means enjoying fabulous Florida weather year-round.
But, when that weather gets a bit extra? Amelia National‚Äôs prime northeast Florida location gives residents plenty of fun things to do indoors (we see you, heat, humidity, and summer showers).
Begin at Amelia National‚Äôs stunning clubhouse, the community‚Äôs amenity anchor. Work up a sweat in the fitness center. Attend a trainer-led yoga or workout class. Meet friends and neighbors for a tasty meal and luscious drinks in the dining room or 19th hole bar and grill. Or, round up those friends and neighbors for a fun cookout on your covered lanai.
And, when it‚Äôs time to seek indoor fun elsewhere, there‚Äôs no lack of activities and entertainment in Amelia National‚Äôs hometown of Fernandina Beach. Cruise through some options below.
Adventures in Reading
Fernandina Beach offers several places to curl up with a good book or to find a new title for your reading list. Browsing a bookstore is also a rewarding indoor activity for kids and grandkids, a sure way to ignite young imaginations and conversations with adults.
A Fernandina Beach branch of the Nassau County Public Library system is located downtown.¬† The Book Loft is another nearby option, as is Story & Song Bookstore Bistro on Park Avenue.
Pro tip: Don‚Äôt miss the annual Amelia Island Book Festival each February.
Artistic Endeavors
Taking an art class not only feeds our creativity, it‚Äôs also a unique way to have fun with folks you know, or to meet new friends indoors.
Several Fernandina Beach-area art studios offer classes in different disciplines such as painting and drawing, plus popular ‚Äúmake-it‚Äù events where an instructor leads attendees step by step through the process of creating an original drawing, pottery piece or embellished sign.
Amelia Makery and Paisley Grace Makery, both downtown Fernandina Beach-based, are two outlets that offer creative events and classes.
Indoor Play
Amelia National residents can still compete when it‚Äôs hot, humid or drizzly outside!
Try Duck Pinz, a mini-bowling alley in downtown Fernandina Beach and Golf Pub Social on Sadler Road. Duck Pinz includes an second-floor bar that overlooks its lanes, and Golf Pub Social offers three playable Trackman golf simulators. A covered patio makes Golf Pub Social inviting even during those summer showers, with table tennis and corn hole boards available for additional competition. Expect pub fare and libations for sustenance.
Tour a Museum
Whether you‚Äôre a current or prospective Amelia National resident, one of the many perks of living in the Fernandina Beach-Amelia Island region is its history. Centuries of major events and historical twists and turns occurred here, and there are multiple museums and conserved historical sites that tell you all about it.
Start with the Amelia Island Museum of History, then branch out to others. Compile a museum checklist for regular comfy indoor outings with family and friends.
Ready for your Amelia National lifestyle? Talk to ICI Homes here. [...] Read more... Amelia National‚Äôs Golf Course Renovation Is Underway April 24, 2025 Crews are now hard at work on Amelia National Golf & Country Club‚Äôs renovation of its storied Tom Fazio-designed golf course.
It‚Äôs an exciting next step for the crown jewel amenity at Fernandina Beach‚Äôs best address. The multi-million-dollar renovation project began in mid-March, after the golf course closed following another active winter season. And although it won‚Äôt be an instantaneous process, the renovation ‚Äî overseen by the course‚Äôs original architectural firm, FAZIO Designs ‚Äî also won‚Äôt be a complete overhaul.
‚ÄúI would say this is more of a re-grassing and a refreshing of the current golf course and the current golf conditions,‚Äù said FAZIO Designs‚Äô Gavin Fazio during a November presentation.

Amelia National is one of ICI Homes‚Äô signature properties in northeast Florida, nestled 10 minutes west of downtown Fernandina Beach and Amelia Island‚Äôs glorious Atlantic beaches.
The Fazio-designed golf course is the centerpiece here, winding throughout this gated community. It provides beautiful natural backdrops to residents‚Äô homes and Amelia National‚Äôs French Provincial clubhouse, which also serves as the amenity hub.


If you‚Äôre a golfing enthusiast seeking a new custom luxury home in northeast Florida, Amelia National should be on your radar. Because soon, you‚Äôll have a better-than-ever course to play!
Here‚Äôs more information.
Diving into details
Amelia National and its golf course opened in 2006. After two decades of enthusiastic use, some tweaking and updating is necessary.
A critical factor is the course‚Äôs original iteration. Tom Fazio designed Amelia National using the existing coastal-forested terrain, placing holes, greens and fairways into an already lovely place.
The current renovation builds off those good bones rather than uprooting everything from scratch. It prioritizes these five goals, as presented by Gavin Fazio and project manager Ron Smith in November:

Improve course conditions with new turf and decrease shade issues.
Renovate course to modern standards for more efficient maintenance.
At some holes, re-position bunkers and add tees for improved strategy and playability.
Improve current practice facilities by re-positioning cart tracks and shifting vegetation, etc., to make a great entrance to the course even better.
Restore greens back to original sizes to maximize hole locations.

A few more deets
Amelia National‚Äôs course will be outfitted with one of the golfing industry‚Äôs cutting-edge turf choices.
FAZIO Design crews will use a technology called Bunker Solution to update bunkers and minimize washout problems. Per Gavin Fazio and Smith, this ensures Amelia National‚Äôs bunkers will contain less square footage and provide better visibility.
Trees will be trimmed and/or removed in select areas to improve vistas and turf growth, and drainage issues will be tackled and solved.
Half of the project‚Äôs multi-million-dollar budget will fund a new golf maintenance facility.
As with any natural site work and terrain processes, a golf course renovation takes time. Amelia National‚Äôs golf professionals are helping residents find golfing resources during the renovation. And don‚Äôt hesitate to enjoy local mini-golf courses.
Stay tuned for updates!
